pages.caption: BLACK FRIDAY — 4:00 AM. The mail has become a natural disaster.
The Thousand-Yard Stare — Four pages long. Twenty Black Fridays survived.
The Shareholders — Not human. Lovecraftian corporate horror watches with hunger.
THE SPRAWL — An alternate dimension of pure corporate optimization emerges.
LLV Cavalry — Battered mail trucks in formation. Blue-collar war machines.
Unmoored — The building shifts between dimensions. Brick becomes chrome.
Heather Holds On — The new generation won't let go. The key is safe.
'Somebody has to deliver the mail.' Stan steps toward The Sprawl.
Dimensional Delivery — The Sprawl. Chrome. Corporate drones. No soul.
TO BE CONTINUED — The rift slams shut. Stan is trapped in The Sprawl.
